iteration_info: The goal of the first iteration was to built a initial clustering of the extracted question types. The clustering was done manually by processing the extracted types from each paper and trying to group them into similar clusters by the semantic meaning of the name and description of the types. For this, for each type it was manually determined whether it would fit any of the existing clusters. If so, the type was added to this cluster. If not, a new cluster was built.

iteration_info: In the second iteration, our goal was two fold. We gave each existing cluster a name and a description. Then based on this information, we grouped the clusters into a parent cluster. This parent cluster is a higher level cluster that groups the clusters based on their similarity in terms of the information they provide.

clusters.name: Knowledge Graph Representation | Knowledge Graph Organization | Fact Granularity
clusters.info: Groups those clusters that describe how the data that is asked for is organized in the Knowledge Graph. It distinguishes between the amount of facts that are needed to answer a question.

subclusters.name: Single Fact
subclusters.info: Classifies questions that can be fully answered by retrieving a single fact from the Knowledge Graph.

subclusters.info: Focuses on answers that ask for names (or named entities) like persons, locations, or objects.

types.name: Name
types.source: The Structure and Performance of an Open-Domain Question Answering System

subclusters.name: Title
subclusters.info: Covers answer types where the answer is expected to be a title such as the title of a publication or work.

types.name: Answer Type - Title
types.source: The Structure and Performance of an Open-Domain Question Answering System

subclusters.name: Bibliometric Numbers
subclusters.info: Specifies answers that involve bibliometric data such as publication counts, citation numbers, h-index, or i10-index.

types.name: Bibliometric Numbers
types.source: Hybrid-SQuAD: Hybrid Scholarly Question Answering Dataset

subclusters.name: Manner
subclusters.info: Used when the answer is expected to detail the manner by which an action is performed.

types.name: Answer Type - Manner
types.source: The Structure and Performance of an Open-Domain Question Answering System

subclusters.name: Software System
subclusters.info: Classifies answers that describe features of a software system, such as its size, complexity, or application domain.

subclusters.info: Given a question, the expected result is a concept for implementation, representation, management, or analysis.

subclusters.name: Instructional
subclusters.info: Covers those questions that expect as answer step-by-step procedures, instructions, or techniques to achieve a specified task.

subclusters.name: Tool/Notation

subclusters.name: Report

subclusters.name: Theoretical Framework
subclusters.info: Questions that ask for theoretical statements that support a research approach. This is categorized into no specific theory, kernel theory, formal theory, or testable theory.

clusters.name: Question Type | Information Retrieval Actions | Question Processing Steps | Retrieval Operations

clusters.name: Specialized Knowledge Base Types
clusters.info: Contains classifications specific to querying specialized knowledge bases. Therefore to apply these classifications, it is required to run the question on that specific knowledge base.

subclusters.name: ORKG and SPARQL Queries
subclusters.info: Classifies questions specific to the ORKG, including those about paper‐based content, comparison instances, and the complexity of underlying SPARQL query structures.

types.source: The SciQA Scientific Question Answering Benchmark for Scholarly Knowledge

subclusters.name: Wikidata Qualifiers
subclusters.info: Specifies questions that require answers including qualifiers (which are additional detail properties in Wikidata) to enrich the retrieved fact.

types.name: Fact with Qualifiers
types.source: LC-QuAD 2.0: A Large Dataset for Complex Question Answering over Wikidata and Dbpedia

clusters.name: Research-Orientation | Research-Focus | Scholarly Question Type
clusters.info: Focuses on scholarly and research-oriented questions

subclusters.name: Research Output
subclusters.info: Classifies questions focused on research outputs from publications

types.name: Research Works
types.source: Hybrid-SQuAD: Hybrid Scholarly Question Answering Dataset

subclusters.name: Development Methods
subclusters.info: Covers questions that request details on the methods, processes, or procedures used to develop software solutions, including aspects such as design patterns, best practices, and algorithmic strategies.

types.name: Method or Means of Development
types.source: Writing good software engineering research papers

subclusters.name: Analytical Methods
subclusters.info: Covers questions that seek details on strategies, techniques, or frameworks used for analyzing or evaluating software tools, technologies, or approaches.

types.name: Method for Analysis or Evaluation
types.source: Writing good software engineering research papers

subclusters.name: Instance-Specific
subclusters.info: The same as 'Development Methods' but specific to a particular instance.

types.name: Design, Evaluation, or Analysis of a particular Instance
types.source: Writing good software engineering research papers

subclusters.name: Generalization
subclusters.info: Classifies questions that seek broad concepts, taxonomies, or general principles in software engineering.

types.name: Generalization or Characterization
types.source: Writing good software engineering research papers

subclusters.name: Qualitative Modeling
subclusters.info: Groups questions expecting qualitative models which covers a wide variety of different types of models, including structures or taxonomies, architecture designs, frameworks, design patterns, and other non quantitative results.

types.name: Qualitative or Descriptive Model
types.source: Writing good software engineering research papers

subclusters.name: Empirical Modeling
subclusters.info: Classifies questions that ask for predictive models based on observed data.

types.name: Empirical Model
types.source: Writing good software engineering research papers

subclusters.name: Analytic Modeling
subclusters.info: Focuses on questions expecting formal, mathematically defined models to facilitate analysis or computation.

types.name: Analytic Model
types.source: Writing good software engineering research papers

clusters.name: Answer Credibility | Answer Reliability
clusters.info: Classifies questions by the credibility of the answer with regard to the truthfulness.

subclusters.name: Factual
subclusters.info: Groups questions that expect factual, evidence-based answers.

types.name: Factual Questions
types.source: Divide and Conquer the EmpiRE: A Community-Maintainable Knowledge Graph of Empirical Research in Requirements Engineering

types.name: Evidence-Based
types.source: A Non-Factoid Question-Answering Taxonomy

types.name: Accuracy
types.source: A Taxonomy for Classifying Questions Asked in Social Question and Answering

subclusters.name: Opinion
subclusters.info: Covers questions where the answer is expected to reflect personal experiences, opinions, or recommendations rather than strict facts.

types.name: Experience
types.source: A Non-Factoid Question-Answering Taxonomy

types.name: Knowledge
types.source: A Taxonomy for Classifying Questions Asked in Social Question and Answering

subclusters.name: Debate
subclusters.info: Classifies questions that intend to provoke discussion or argumentation rather than factual answers.

types.name: Debate
types.source: A Non-Factoid Question-Answering Taxonomy

subclusters.name: Conversational
subclusters.info: Identifies questions that are rhetorical or conversational in nature, where a definitive factual answer is not required.

types.name: Conversational
types.source: A Taxonomy for Classifying Questions Asked in Social Question and Answering

types.name: Zero Order
types.source: The Classification of Research Questions

subclusters.name: Predictive
subclusters.info: Focuses on questions that ask for predictions or forecasts.

types.name: Predictive
types.source: Types of research questions: descriptive, predictive, or causal

clusters.name: Question Goal | Question Intent | Question Objective
clusters.info: Defines the overall goal or intent behind a question.

subclusters.name: Exploratory
subclusters.info: Classifies questions aimed at exploring the existence, description, or comparative features of a phenomenon.

types.name: Exploratory - Existence

types.name: Exploratory - Description and Classification
types.source: Selecting Empirical Methods for Software Engineering Research

types.name: Exploratory - Descriptive-Comparative

types.name: Feasibility Study or Exploration

subclusters.name: Reasoning
subclusters.info: Classifies questions that seek reasons or causes behind events or phenomena.

types.name: Reason
types.source: A Non-Factoid Question-Answering Taxonomy

types.name: Answer Type - Reason
types.source: The Structure and Performance of an Open-Domain Question Answering System

subclusters.name: Problem Solving
subclusters.info: Focuses on questions that seek to find solutions or resolve issues.

types.name: Motivation - Problem Solving
types.source: Construction of Design Science Research Questions

subclusters.name: Gap Spotting
subclusters.info: Classifies questions that aim to spot gaps in existing literature or research, thereby highlighting areas needing further investigation.

types.name: Motivation - Gap Spotting
types.source: Construction of Design Science Research Questions

subclusters.name: Problematization
subclusters.info: Classifies questions that aim to articulate deficiencies or problems in current theories and practices suggesting a need for additional research.

types.name: Motivation - Problematization
types.source: Construction of Design Science Research Questions

subclusters.name: Focus
subclusters.info: Generally defines the aim of a question as the focus, which should guide the extraction of most relevant information from the Knowledge Graph

types.name: Question Analysis/Focus
types.source: The question answering systems: A survey

types.name: Focus
types.source: The Structure and Performance of an Open-Domain Question Answering System

subclusters.name: Design
subclusters.info: Discovering improved methods for software design.

types.name: Design
types.source: Selecting Empirical Methods for Software Engineering Research

clusters.name: Application-Specific
clusters.info: Groups those clusters where the type is specific to an application or use case and not useful for our task.

subclusters.name: Problem Statement Identification
subclusters.info: Defines the issue being addressed. This could be a research challenge, gap, problem, opportunity, or a specific requirement.

types.name: Problem Statement
types.source: Construction of Design Science Research Questions

subclusters.name: Research Question Utilization
subclusters.info: Whether a publication has used research questions at all.

types.name: Usage of RQ
types.source: Construction of Design Science Research Questions

subclusters.name: Research Question Typology
subclusters.info: Categorizes broad types related to the design process, product, knowledge or other types.

types.name: Types of RQ
types.source: Construction of Design Science Research Questions

subclusters.name: Inquiry Mode Classification
subclusters.info: Defines the activities required for the question. This can be developmental, evaluative, or a mix of both.

types.name: Research Activities - Mode of Inquiry
types.source: Construction of Design Science Research Questions

subclusters.name: Outcome Artifact Classification
subclusters.info: Encompasses categories such as instantiation, model, construct, and method. Additionally, it incorporates mixed categories, such as model combined with instantiation, and another combination consisting of construct, model, and instantiation.

types.name: Outcome Artifacts
types.source: Construction of Design Science Research Questions

subclusters.name: Missing Term Resolution
subclusters.info: Defines a question where two key parts are missing. It requires to find both a relation and a term.

types.name: UnknTerm
types.source: Ripple Down Rules for question answering

subclusters.name: Three Term Resolution
subclusters.info: Question either asks for the relation or concept

types.name: ThreeTerm
types.source: Ripple Down Rules for question answering

subclusters.name: Human Relationship Inquiry
subclusters.info: Focuses on questions that capture relationships between people

types.name: Human Relations
types.source: Linguistically Motivated Question Classification

subclusters.name: Multi Category Classification
subclusters.info: General type for question that span multiple categories simultaneously

types.name: Multilabel
types.source: Linguistically Motivated Question Classification

subclusters.name: NNP Answer Type
subclusters.info: Uknown what this type is used for

types.name: Answer Type - NNP

subclusters.name: Resource Typed
subclusters.info: Classifies questions that expect a single resource of a specific, predefined type as the answer.

types.name: Resource Typed
types.source: What is in the KGQA Benchmark Datasets? Survey on Challenges in Datasets for Question Answering on Knowledge Graphs

subclusters.name: Resource Untyped
subclusters.info: Specifies questions that expect an answer in the form of a resource without any explicit type classification.

types.name: Resource Untyped
types.source: What is in the KGQA Benchmark Datasets? Survey on Challenges in Datasets for Question Answering on Knowledge Graphs
